node.name: Xcarecrows 4 MDA
node.shortdescription:
The Xcarecrows 4 MDA Eclipse plugin provides a toolchain to
  • build models
  • check their behavior
  • transform them toward applications
Xcarecrows 4 MDA uses a hierarchical, state driven approach and includes a test generation component to verify the safety of the models. The validated models can thus be used in software applications or in complex systems.

Features

  • a graphical editor to design models
  • a built-in checker to validate models
  • a test and coverage tool to check that each part of the model is exercised at least once
  • a tool to transform the platform independent model into a Java source-code library

Packaging

  • Windows and Linux support (platform neutral Java)
  • Free online updates
  • Installation guide
  • User documentation
  • Sample tutorial code

Licensing
Xcarecrows 4 MDA is available under the Open Source Apache License version 2.

Changes from version 1.2.9

  • Fixed a bug where wrong models could not be read once written
  • Fixed a bug where warnings were still displayed after correction
  • Fixed a bug where the dirty flag was not correctly set for multiple editors (updated to version 1.3.9 of Xcarecrows4XGT)

Changes from version 1.2.8

  • Diagnostic messages have been modified for use with Xcarecrows 4 MDI

Changes from version 1.2.6

  • Update of the stateMachine compiler to match the Ready for IBM Rational software Integration Requirements V7.0.3
  • Missing icon in the editor (updated to version 1.3.6 of Xcarecrows4XGT)

Changes from version 1.2.4

  • Fixed a bug in the compilation of models for XP users (Eclipse 3.3)
  • Multiple editor feature
  • Xcarecrows4MDA-Light renamed to Xcarecrows4MDA-Core

Changes from version 1.2.3

  • Projects are directly created with the Xcarecrows4MDA nature to automate the build
  • The Xcarecrows library jar and the Apache log4j library jar are automatically added to the classpath of the new Xcarecrow4MDA projects

Changes from version 1.2.2

  • Java code is automatically produced from the model with a builder associated to a new Project nature

Changes from version 1.2.1

  • Added a new tutorial to the embedded Eclipse documentation

Changes from version 1.2.0

  • Fixed a bug in the compilation of models for XP users

The Xcarecrows 4 MDA Eclipse plugin provides a toolchain to
  • build models
  • check their behavior
  • transform them toward applications
Xcarecrows 4 MDA uses a hierarchical, state driven approach and includes a test generation component to verify the safety of the models. The validated models can thus be used in software applications or in complex systems.

  • a graphical editor to design models
  • a built-in checker to validate models
  • a test and coverage tool to check that each part of the model is exercised at least once

Packaging

Xcarecrows 4 MDA is available under the Open Source Apache License version 2.

Changes from version 1.2.9
